questions.text: Which of the following is true about cholesterol?

options.label: B
options.text: There is a hydroxyl group at 5th carbon

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Amphipathic in nature Cholesterol: Made up of 27 carbons The ring in cholesterol is cyclo-penta-perhydrophenanthrene (CPP) One of the major constituents of the plasma membrane and plasma lipoproteins. A hydroxyl group is present at position 3. Due to one -OH group, it has a weak polar character among the mostly non-polar part. Hence it is an amphipathic molecule.

questions.text: All of the following statements are true about regulating cholesterol synthesis, EXCEPT?

options.label: A
options.text: HMG-CoA reductase is inhibited by mevalonate

options.label: B
options.text: HMG-CoA reductase is inhibited by cholesterol

options.label: C
options.text: SREBP increases the transcription of HMG-CoA reductase

options.label: D
options.text: Thyroid hormone decreases the HMG-CoA reductase activity

questions.correct_answer: D. Thyroid hormone decreases the HMG-CoA reductase activity
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Thyroid hormone decreases the HMG-CoA reductase activity Cholesterol Metabolism Mevalonate and cholesterol both allosterically inhibit HMG-CoA reductase ( options a and b are correct) Transcription of the HMG-CoA reductase gene is regulated by a transcription factor known as SREBP (sterol regulatory element binding protein) Binding of this SREBP protein to DNA sequences known as SRE (sterol regulatory element) located 5’ to the HMG-CoA reductase gene ↑ the transcription. So SREBP increases the HMG-CoA transcription (option c is correct) Insulin or thyroid hormone ↑ HMG-CoA reductase activity (option d is false and hence is the answer) Glucagon or glucocorticoids ↓ it

questions.text: Cholesterol, its precursors, and its products perform various functions within cells. Which of the following statement/s correctly describes a function of a cholesterol precursor, cholesterol itself, or a product derived from cholesterol? Cholesterol is amphipathic Steroid hormones are precursors of cholesterol Precursors of cholesterol can be converted to vitamin D Cholesterol is primarily present in esterified form in the core of lipoprotein particles Malonyl-CoA is the primary precursor of cholesterol synthesis. Select the correct answer from the given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1, 3, and 4 are correct Cholesterol is considered amphipathic due to the presence of the OH group. It is a precursor of bile acids and steroid hormones. Cholesterol precursors are converted to ubiquinone, dolichol, and cholecalciferol (the active form of vitamin D). Cholesterol is converted to esterified form by LCAT and stored in the core of HDL lipoproteins. Malonyl-CoA is the precursor of fatty acids; acetyl-CoA is the precursor for all the cholesterol carbons.

questions.text: Mevalonate is one of the intermediates in the biosynthesis of cholesterol. Mevalonate is a precursor for the synthesis of all of the following compounds except
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Ubiquitin Cholesterol synthetic pathway is also involved in the synthesis of many other essential compounds such as: Farnesyl pyrophosphate and geranyl pyrophosphate → involved in prenylation of proteins. Dolichol → involved in N-glycosylation of proteins in the endoplasmic reticulum. Ubiquinone (Q10) → is the electron carrier in the mitochondrial respiratory chain. Inhibition of ubiquinone synthesis is one of the reasons for statin-induced myopathy. Ubiquitin protein is not synthesized by any of the cholesterol synthesis pathways intermediates.

questions.text: Which of the following is the rate-limiting enzyme of bile acid synthesis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Microsomal 7-α hydroxylase microsomal 7-α hydroxylase is rate-limiting enzyme of bile acid synthesis. It catalyzes the first step in synthesizing bile acid from cholesterol to form 7α-hydroxycholesterol as 7α-hydroxylase is a microsomal CYP450 enzyme, which requires NADPH, oxygen, and vitamin C as co-factors.

questions.text: Statins are a class of drug molecules used to lower elevated serum cholesterol by inhibiting the major rate-limiting step of cholesterol synthesis. A statin therapy would cause a rise in which of the metabolite of the cholesterol biosynthesis pathway?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

HMG-CoA The statins inhibit the enzyme HMG-CoA reductase, which reduces HMG-CoA to mevalonic acid. Therefore, HMG-CoA would be the metabolite that accumulates.

questions.text: The bile salts are amphipathic compounds synthesized in the liver and secreted via the gallbladder into the intestinal lumen to help in the digestion and absorption of dietary fats. The precursor for Bile salt synthesis is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Acetyl CoA Bile acids are synthesized from cholesterol (by modification of side chain), which is synthesized from Acetyl CoA. Bile acids consist of Deoxycholic acid, Lithocholic acid, and Chenodeoxycholic acid. Extra Information: Bile acids are more appropriately called bile salts Present in deprotonated form Made in the liver (RLE is 7-a-Hydroxylase) Stored in the gallbladder Emulsify the dietary fat, which increases the surface area.

questions.text: A 57-year-old male patient with high levels of triglyceride and LDL-cholesterol, has premature cholesterol gallstone disease. The patient took statins (HMG-CoA-reductase inhibitors) for the last three years, which did not reduce his complications. The same problems were also noted in two of his siblings. Dyslipidemia in this patient can be best explained by:

options.label: C
options.text: Abnormal phospholipids influx in the gallbladder due to ileal disease

questions.correct_answer: B. A loss of CYP7A1 (cholesterol 7α-hydroxylase) function
questions.explanation:
Solution:

A loss of CYP7A1 (cholesterol 7α-hydroxylase) function CYP7A1 malfunction will lead to lousy cholesterol to bile salts conversion. Elevated triglyceride and LDL-cholesterol, premature cholesterol gallstone can result from blocking cholesterol breakdown enzymes. As a result, cholesterol accumulates in the bile along with the decreased synthesis of bile salt, which helps in cholesterol deposition leading to the formation of cholesterol gallstones. Statin therapy can control the only rate of cholesterol synthesis but cannot accelerate cholesterol degradation. The increase in blood triglyceride levels in CYP7A1 deficiency is not well understood, but there is a reciprocal relationship between bile acid synthesis and TG levels. Finally, as siblings have same conditions, it appears to be a genetic disorder, which points to a possible mutated gene and likely prevents the function of CYP7A1.

Explaination for incorrect options:- Option: A - HMG-CoA reductase function loss will also lead to decreased formation of cholesterol, but this patient has high cholesterol levels. High levels of LCAT will lead to increased formation of mature HDL, containing cholesterol esters. The question does not mention such a thing, so option C is ruled out.

questions.text: Cholesterol is an amphipathic substance required to make hormones and vitamin D. It contains a steroid nucleus with an OH group. Which of the following fatty acid is part of cholesterol?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

None Fatty acid is not present in cholesterol Cholesterol structure It has 27 Carbons and an –OH group at C3. Four fused hydrocarbon rings (A to D) are known as the Steroid nucleus. A branched hydrocarbon chain is attached at C-17. Structure of Cholesterol

questions.text: Acetyl-CoA is the starting material for synthesizing cholesterol and ketone bodies with the same initial steps. Which of the following enzyme is common to cholesterol synthesis and ketone body synthesis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

HMG CoA Synthase Enzymes common to cholesterol synthesis & ketone body synthesis are HMG CoA Synthase & Thiolase. HMG CoA Synthase ( Option 2 ) is the rate-limiting step in Ketone Body synthesis. HMG CoA Reductase ( Option 1 ) is the rate-limiting step in cholesterol synthesis. Beta-hydroxybutyrate Dehydrogenase ( Option 3 ) is only used in ketone body synthesis. Thiophorase ( Option 4 ) is the first enzyme in ketone body utilization. First two steps of Cholesterol Synthesis are the same as Ketone Body Synthesis, but Cholesterol Synthesis occurs in Cytoplasm , whereas Ketone Body Synthesis occurs in Mitochondria .

questions.text: A 4-day-old girl is kept in the nursery because of persistent neonatal jaundice with an atypical elevation of conjugated bilirubin. Elevated levels of liver transaminases (SGOT and SGPT) revealed that the infant has liver disease. Family history indicated that child is most probably suffering from an inborn error of bile acid metabolism. Which of the following compounds is usually used to conjugate bile acids?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Glycine Bile acids are in the deprotonated form at physiological pH. They are made in the liver and stored in the gall bladder, emulsifying the dietary fat, which increases the surface area. They are formed from cholesterol by modification of the side chain. Primary bile acid conjures in the liver with glycine or taurine to form glycocholic acid and taurocholic acid, respectively. The presence of the charged carboxyl group of glycine or the charged sulfate of taurine adds to the hydrophilic nature of the bile acids, thereby increasing their ability to emulsify lipids during the digestive process. A group of rare inborn errors affects the enzymes of bile acid synthesis, resulting in the accumulation of toxic acids in the liver. Patients with these disorders may have a lethal accumulation of abnormal bile acids and conjugated bilirubin in the liver due to cholestasis (abnormal concentration of bile acids in the gall bladder), illustrated by infants with a defective cholic acid synthesis that lives 4 to 6 months on average.
